publisher.value: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG

description.value: Characteristics or strengths of individuals, families, community situations or societies that mitigate risks and promote positivewell-being and healthy development; attributes that help to successfully navigate difficult situations; factors that may contribute to or explain positive outcomes. A trait or habit that "protects" people and makes them less likely to get a chronic disease that include, but are not limited to exercise, healthy eating, managing weight, managing blood pressure and cholesterol, managing mental health, feeling happy, strong emotional support and social connections.

short.value: Characteristics or strengths of individuals, families, community situations or societies that mitigate risks and promote positivewell-being and healthy development

A trait or habit that "protects" people and makes them less likely to get a chronic disease that include, but are not limited to exercise, healthy eating, managing weight, managing blood pressure and cholesterol, managing mental health, feeling happy, strong emotional support and social connections.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
